User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the GuardianMail application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

registrationDate.description: The date and time when the user registered.

profileImageUrl.description: URL of the user's profile image.

UserSettings.title: User Settings
UserSettings.description: Stores user-specific settings for the GuardianMail application.

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity level for phishing detection, from 0 to 100.

replyTone.description: The desired tone for AI-assisted replies.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. Path-based ownership ensures only the authenticated user (userId) can access their own data.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user. This is used for path-based authorization.

definition.description: Stores individual user settings documents, like 'ai'. Access is restricted to the owner.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

params.name: settingId
params.description: The unique identifier for the setting document (e.g., 'ai').

firestore.reasoning: The data structure prioritizes authorization independence and clarity for security rules. User data is stored under `/users/{userId}` for path-based ownership. A subcollection for settings `/users/{userId}/settings/{settingId}` allows for granular control and ensures settings can be managed without affecting the main user document. This eliminates the need for complex `get()` calls in security rules, as access control is directly tied to the user's ID.
